fields.description:
If using a custom elastic image with Bamboo, then, when you upgrade Bamboo, you also need to upgrade the agent on the image, build a new image etc.  What would be great is if the old elastic agent could detect this, and do the upgrade automatically, ie download the agent jar from the Bamboo server, install it and then run it.  This would make for a much better user experience with custom elastic images.

This is an issue when using remote agents as well, with the 100 user license: customers have to now upgrade 100 remote agents with each server upgrade.
fields.summary: Automatic EC2 agent upgrade

fields.description: There is no documentation on how to upgrade the Bamboo agent on an elastic custom image, and no mention (or rather, warning) in the custom elastic image creation documentation that the agent will need to be upgraded and a new image created every time the Bamboo server is upgraded.
fields.summary: Document custom elastic image upgrade process

fields.description:
The following build specific variables are available in Bamboo 2.4:
|| Build-specific variable || Source || Description ||
| buildKey | Bamboo property \\ | The plan key for the build, e.g. {{BAM-MAIN}} |
| buildNumber | Bamboo property | The Bamboo build number, e.g. {{123}} |
| custom.svn.revision.number | Plugin \\ | _(For Subversion only)_ The revision number |
| custom.cvs.last.update.time | Plugin | _(For CVS only)_ The last updated timestamp |
| custom.p4.revision.number | Plugin | _(For Perforce only)_ The change set number |

We should also plan name to this list.
fields.summary: Add plan name to the list of build specific variables

fields.description:
This issue has come up more than a few times in the past, when triggering a build from remote server Bamboo will ignore the trigger if the local working copy is the latest version.

This is quite misleading, as a customer who is new to bamboo and configuring the build trigger expects a build. 

We should log that the build was not triggered as there were no updates to the local working copy.

I have added a warning [to the docs|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Triggering+a+Build+on+Code+Check-in], but then again it would be nice if we logged this.
fields.summary: Improvements to logging on build trigger stratergy.
Make tabs not have the dotted outline

fields.summary: Upgrade Ehcache library

fields.description:
In the list of historical builds (/build/viewBuildHistory), it would be great if the agent which a build ran on was a column in the table. This would let you visually correlate build times, successes and failures against particular agents which are misbehaving.

For example, we have the occasional slow build which runs for 30% longer than the others. See the attached screenshot. If we could tell that these slower builds were always on agent X, we could investigate the situation on that agent to try to rectify it.
fields.summary: Include agent information in build history list
Ensure we make the import from Maven feature clear to users

fields.description:
Subversion change detection uses the latest repository revision not the latest revision at the specified repository url.

If there is another project in the same repository that has a later commit than the subtree changes are detected on then {{custom.svn.revision.number}} will be set to the revision of that project and not the latest change in the working copy. This is an issue for users who wish to brand their artifacts using {{custom.svn.revision.number}} because even if their project has not changed subsequent builds will produce artifacts with different revision number stamps if there have been other changes made in the repository.

One possible way of fixing this is to replace the use of {{repository.getLatestRevision}} and use the "Last change rev" revision id from an svn info command instead (in SVNKit this is called the "committed version").
fields.summary: Subversion change detection uses the latest repository revision not the latest revision at the specified repository url

fields.description:
We have "official" and "CI" builds. CI builds are repository polling and Official builds are mostly either "scheduled builds (Daily single/ cron based)" or Manual builds only.

A) We do a lot of extra stuff in official builds and this is why it takes very long  for official build to complete compared to CI build so we prefer triggering a official build only during night time

B) We need to maintain somewhat close to 100% success rate on Official builds. 
To For this we have to make sure that Official build is triggered only when CI build is successful and doing this in night would mean manual monitoring and triggering a build if CI is successful.

In order to satisfy both the conditions above we need to come up with a build a condition for Official builds to execute when this is true: 

Trigger a build at scheduled time AND CI-build is successful.

Current build strategy provide options like:
1) Repository polling
2) Cron/based
3) Manual/ Dependent
4) Single daily build
5) Repository triggers the build.

I cannot use any of them which would make sure my official build will automatically trigger provided the CI build is successful and be 100% successful other than manual build.

Regards
Rohit
fields.summary: Add optional condition for scheduled builds

fields.description:
We use perforce for code repository and bamboo for CI for our build plans. In the logsfile for any bamboo plan, it starts logging with something like:

simple	04-Dec-2009 07:48:17	Executing build XXXXXX
simple	04-Dec-2009 07:48:17	Running pre-build action: Build Number Stamper
simple	04-Dec-2009 07:48:18	Running pre-build action: VCS Version Collector
simple	04-Dec-2009 07:48:19	Building started with ScriptBuilder
.
.
.

Is it possible to print the changelist# to which source is synced to this log file. 

I know it shows up a log something like "sync the code to latest" and it shows the perforce changelist number when looking at logs while the build is actually running but it doesnt write it to logs. Just writing that to logfile is all I am requesting!

Regards
Rohit

fields.description:
EC2 EBS snapshots now support descriptions of up to 250 characters.  This means we can label snapshots and hence be able to make sense of what snapshots we have actually created in the console, and easily clean up old ones.

To support this, we need to upgrade to the latest EC2 api client tools, and in the {{generateSnapshot.sh}} script, add a {{-d}} flag to the {{ec2-create-snapshot}} command execution to supply a description.
fields.summary: Support EBS snapshot descriptions

fields.description:
Although Bamboo can run in 64-bit Windows with a 64-bit JVM, it is not possible to run the standalone Bamboo installer for Windows unless you have a 32-bit JVM installed.

The install4j installer requires a 32-bit JVM. So in order to set up Bamboo with a 64-bit JVM on Windows I had to temporarily install a 32-bit JVM which isn't actually going to be used by Bamboo. It should be possible to use the Bamboo installer with either a 32-bit JVM or a 64-bit JVM.

See attachment for the error that appears during installation when only a 64-bit JVM is available.
fields.summary: Cannot use Windows Bamboo installer when only a 64-bit JVM is available
